revised_title: Surface Wave Excitation by Sub-Surface Sources in a Half-Space
tldr: This article presents a method for determining surface waves produced by a buried source in a half-space. The authors introduce an 'emission function' that characterizes the angular variation of the outgoing field, and they show that the surface-wave amplitude is equal to the value of this function at a complex angle. The method can be applied to various types of sources and geometries, providing a means to analyze surface wave excitation by combining ray theory with integral representation of the wave field.
